page.title: 06QUATT SHROPSHIRE
page.content: { Quatt}is a small linear village on the A442. It was a{Roman settlement which has not been really developed, because it is on National Trust land, where{development is limited. The only notable event to have occured at Quatt was during the 2nd World War, when an RAF camp was there. As a result Quatt Cricket Club has seen several famous cricketers, such as{Cyril Washbrook.}The cricket pitch is very small and is the only leisure facility in Quatt. Nowadays Quatt is a residential area, where pensioners live. The only new buildings are the water-works and telephone exchange. The only other buildings are a church, garage with a village shop and sub-post office.There is one bus service although the main transport is by car.Young people view the village as{"boring".
